      • nameMapper

        protected Map<String,AbstractAreaTriggerManager.AreaTrigger> nameMapper

      • entityLocationMap

        protected final Map<UUID,SimpleLocation> entityLocationMap
        The child class should update this map with its own way. Though, the entity which garbage-corrected will be also deleted from this map automatically. Adding or removing from this map also has to be reflected in entityTrackMap as well

      • entityTrackMap

        protected final Map<UUID,WeakReference<IEntity>> entityTrackMap
        The actual entity map. Adding or removing from this map also has to be reflected in entityLocationMap as well

      • getConflictingAreas

        public Set<Area> getConflictingAreas(Area area)
        get all the area that is conflicting with given area. This does not include the area itself. It's quite a CPU intensive work; use it wisely
        Parameters:
        area -
        Returns:
        never be null; can be empty if no conflicts are found

      • createArea

        public boolean createArea(String name,
                          SimpleLocation smallest,
                          SimpleLocation largest)
        This method does not check if world of smallest and largest are same. Also check confliction with #getConflictingAreas(SimpleLocation, SimpleLocation) before using this method.
        Parameters:
        name -
        smallest -
        largest -
        Returns:
        true on success; false if name already exist.

        Try to remove Area Trigger by given name
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • deleteInfo

        protected void deleteInfo(AbstractTriggerManager.Trigger trigger)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTriggerManager
